Financial compensation was awarded to all applicants under the Danish LSD Damages Law due to LSD-inflicted harm.
population_specificity: 151 psychiatric patients treated with LSD in Denmark between 1960 and 1973.
study_duration: Treatment duration not specified, but side effects persisted many years afterward.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how LSD affects behavior in mice with partial serotonin transporter (Sert) deficiency compared to wild-type mice.
results_summary: LSD increased serotonin-sensitive behaviors (head twitching, tremors, backwards gait) in both Sert(+/+) and Sert(+/-) mice, but Sert(+/-) mice showed longer self-grooming regardless of LSD treatment. No significant interactions between LSD and Sert gene dosage were observed.
population_specificity: Heterozygous Sert(+/-) mice and wild-type Sert(+/+) mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of enzyme replacement therapy (ERT) for adults with late-onset Pompe disease.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in muscle strength and walking distance (6MWT) over the first 2 years of ERT, but no significant effects on respiratory function or BMI.
population_specificity: Adults with late-onset Pompe disease (N=62) attending a specialist treatment center in England.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the safety and long-term efficacy of LSD-assisted psychotherapy in reducing anxiety and improving quality of life in patients with life-threatening diseases.
results_summary: Participants reported sustained reductions in anxiety (77.8%) and improved quality of life (66.7%) over 12 months, with no lasting adverse reactions. Subjective experiences included emotional catharsis, confrontation of anxieties, and lasting psychological restructuring.
population_specificity: Patients with anxiety associated with life-threatening diseases.

study_goal: The researchers sought to test the effect of LSD on suggestibility and cued mental imagery in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: Volunteers gave significantly higher ratings for suggestibility (CIS) under LSD compared to placebo, but cued mental imagery (MIT) was unaffected. The suggestibility-enhancing effect of LSD was positively correlated with baseline trait conscientiousness.
population_specificity: Ten healthy volunteers
study_duration: Single administration, assessments at 110 and 140 minutes post-infusion

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the long-term behavioral and molecular effects of chronic LSD administration in rats, particularly its relevance to psychiatric illnesses like schizophrenia.
results_summary: Chronic LSD administration in rats led to persistent abnormal behaviors resembling schizophrenia, including hyperactivity and reduced social interaction. RNA-sequencing revealed widespread gene expression changes in the mPFC, affecting neurotransmission, synaptic plasticity, and energy metabolism, with overlap in genes implicated in schizophrenia.
population_specificity: Rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of enzyme replacement therapy (ERT) for adults and children with Fabry disease.
results_summary: The study found a statistically significant association between ERT and a small linear decrease in left ventricular mass index (LVMI), reduced risk of proteinuria, and a small increase in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) in adults. No significant associations were found for pain, hearing, or stroke/TIA risk, and no effectiveness was demonstrated in children.
population_specificity: Adults (N=289) and children (N=22) with Fabry disease attending a specialist treatment center in England.
study_duration: Up to 9.7 years for adults, up to 4.2 years for children
interactions: Adjusted for angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the natural history of lysosomal storage disorders (LSDs) and estimate the effectiveness and cost of therapies for specific LSDs in the UK.
results_summary: The study collected clinical data from 711 patients with various LSDs but did not report specific findings in the abstract; results are detailed in condition-specific articles.
population_specificity: Adults and children in the UK with confirmed diagnoses of Gaucher disease, Fabry disease, MPS I, MPS II, Pompe disease, or NPC.
study_duration: Data was collected from 2008 to 2011 (3 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to document cases of LSD-related flashbacks involving new visual imagery not experienced during initial intoxication.
results_summary: Two patients with prior LSD use reported benign flashbacks featuring new visual imagery, distinct from prior LSD experiences, which resolved spontaneously within a year without functional impairment.
population_specificity: Two patients with a history of LSD use experiencing HPPD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of enzyme replacement therapies (ERT) for adults with Gaucher disease (GD).
results_summary: The study found that ERT was associated with statistically significant improvements in platelet count, hemoglobin, liver and spleen volumes, and AST levels in adults with GD. These results support the long-term effectiveness of ERT for this condition.
population_specificity: Consenting adults (N=150, aged 16 to 83 years) with a diagnosis of GD who attended a specialist treatment center in England.
study_duration: Mean treatment duration was 10.8 years (range 0-18 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chronic treatment with the mGlu2/3 receptor antagonist LY341495 could reduce the hallucinogenic-like effects of LSD in mice.
results_summary: Chronic LY341495 treatment down-regulated 5-HT(2A) receptor binding and significantly decreased LSD-induced head-twitch behavior and gene expression (c-fos, egr-1, egr-2), suggesting reduced hallucinogenic effects.
population_specificity: Wild-type and mGlu2 knockout (KO) mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore why LSD psychotherapy research declined in the 1960s, focusing on the challenges posed by controlled clinical trial requirements introduced by the 1962 Drug Amendments.
results_summary: The study found that LSD psychotherapy's complex methodology clashed with controlled trial designs, making it difficult to establish efficacy. The new emphasis on rigorous trial design diverted researchers' focus from therapeutic methods, contributing to the decline of LSD research.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of historical LSD psychotherapy research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of chronic clozapine treatment on LSD-induced cellular and behavioral responses in mice as a model of psychosis.
results_summary: Chronic clozapine reduced LSD-induced head-twitch response and downregulated 5-HT(2A) receptor binding and mRNA expression, with some effects persisting up to 14 days post-treatment. C-fos induction was rescued 7 days after clozapine, but LSD-specific markers (egr-1, egr-2) were unaffected.
population_specificity: Mice (somatosensory cortex focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of LSD in treating alcoholism through a quantitative meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a beneficial effect of LSD on alcohol misuse (OR, 1.96; 95% CI, 1.36-2.84; p = 0.0003), with negligible heterogeneity between trials (I² = 0%). A single dose of LSD, within various treatment programs, was associated with reduced alcohol misuse.
population_specificity: 536 participants with alcoholism across six trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the behavioral pharmacology of LSD, specifically its receptor binding properties and the role of 5-HT(2A) and D(1) receptors in eliciting head bob behavior in an animal model.
results_summary: The study found that LSD-elicited head bobs required activation of 5-HT(2A) and D(1) receptors, with LSD binding pseudo-irreversibly to 5-HT(2A) receptors and showing modest D(1) receptor affinity. These findings suggest a common mechanism for hallucinogen-induced behaviors.
population_specificity: Rabbits

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on LSD-associated rhabdomyolysis and present a new case report of a patient who developed rhabdomyolysis after LSD ingestion.
results_summary: The study found limited reports of rhabdomyolysis in patients who ingested LSD, despite it being frequently listed as a cause. The discussion outlines potential mechanisms and management strategies for LSD-associated rhabdomyolysis.
population_specificity: A previously healthy patient who suffered rhabdomyolysis after LSD ingestion (case report) and broader literature review.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to report a rare case of ergotism related to LSD ingestion and describe an unconventional treatment for associated vasospasm.
results_summary: The study found that LSD ingestion led to ergotism and severe lower extremity vasospasm, which was treated with balloon percutaneous transluminal angioplasty. The abstract does not discuss LSD's intended effects or outcomes beyond this adverse event.
population_specificity: A single case of a patient with LSD-induced ergotism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the temporal phases of LSD intoxication in rats and assess whether chronic low-dose LSD administration could serve as an animal model of psychosis.
results_summary: The study found that LSD's effects in rats occur in two distinct phases mediated by different receptors (5-HT2A initially, D2-like later). Chronic LSD administration induced persistent psychosis-like behaviors, reversed transiently by antipsychotics, and altered neurotransmitter-related gene expression.
population_specificity: Rats (older and younger animals)
interactions: Haloperidol, olanzapine, MDL-100907 (mentioned for behavioral reversal or insensitivity)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review LSD's history, pharmacology, and potential benefits in treating addictions.
results_summary: The study found that LSD has potential benefits for addiction treatment but also noted adverse effects leading to its classification as an illicit drug. Further research into its therapeutic potential is warranted.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of literature).

study_goal: The researchers reviewed historical studies to assess how LSD was justified, its methods, results, and conclusions in treating children with autism.
results_summary: Several positive outcomes were reported with LSD use, but most studies lacked proper controls and relied on narrative/descriptive data. The justification for LSD use was often based on the failure of other treatments.
population_specificity: Children with autism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe a case of new-onset LSD flashback syndrome triggered by SSRIs in a patient with a history of LSD use.
results_summary: The study reported a troubling array of unusual side effects in a patient, which were postulated to be LSD flashbacks induced by SSRIs. No broader efficacy or safety conclusions about LSD were drawn.
population_specificity: A patient with a history of LSD use requiring antidepressant treatment.

study_goal: The study does not address LSD; it examines the effectiveness of enzyme replacement therapies (ERT) for children with Gaucher disease (GD).
results_summary: The study found that ERT significantly improved platelet count, hemoglobin levels, and reduced bone pain in children with GD, with greater effects observed in GD3 patients compared to GD1.
population_specificity: Children aged 1.1 to 15.6 years with Gaucher disease (14 with GD1 and 11 with GD3).
study_duration: Mean treatment duration was 5.57 years (range 0-13.7 years).

study_goal: The abstract does not mention LSD or its effects; it focuses on histone epigenetic modifications and cardiac metabolism disorders.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss LSD or its effects; it reviews cardiac acetyl-CoA-dependent histone acetylation and NAD-related mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract does not mention LSD or a study population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of LSD and other psychedelics in treating mental disorders such as anxiety, affective disorders, and addictions.
results_summary: Preliminary studies showed promising therapeutic effects of LSD and psilocybin when used as a supplement to psychotherapy, with no serious side effects reported. However, further large-scale studies are needed to confirm these findings and assess practical applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (general mention of mental health applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate LSD's effects on dopamine D2/3 receptor availability in living brain tissue and its potential contribution to LSD's psychoactive properties.
results_summary: The study found a 19% reduction in dopamine D2/3 receptor binding potential in pig striatum 4 hours after LSD administration, suggesting a direct interaction. No significant changes in cerebral blood flow or interstitial dopamine concentrations were observed.
population_specificity: Pigs (in vivo PET study) and rat brain tissue (in vitro microdialysis).
study_duration: Acute administration with measurements at 1 and 4 hours post-dose.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of risperidone treatment in schizophrenic patients with prior LSD abuse and evaluate transient visual disturbances resembling LSD "flashbacks."
results_summary: Two schizophrenic patients with prior LSD abuse experienced transient visual disturbances resembling LSD flashbacks after starting risperidone, but these resolved without recurrence over six months. The study suggests this is a benign, self-limiting side effect that does not contraindicate risperidone use.
population_specificity: Schizophrenic patients with a history of LSD abuse and prior EPS from classic antipsychotics.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a combination of NT-3 and LSD could facilitate functional recovery in rats with spinal cord injuries.
results_summary: The study found that NT-3 + LSD treatment improved polysynaptic connections and behavioral outcomes (hindlimb kicks and rearing) in rats with spinal cord injuries, while neither NT-3 nor LSD alone had an effect. Improvements were observed as early as P9 and persisted through testing.
population_specificity: Postnatal day 2 (P2) rats with spinal cord injuries (double hemisection or complete transection).
effective_dosage: Intrathecal administration during surgery and subcutaneous doses at P4, P6, P8, and P10 (exact amounts not specified).
study_duration: Intervention administered from P2 to P10, with behavioral testing up to P58.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether naturalistic psychedelic use (primarily LSD and psilocybin) could lead to cessation or reduction in problematic alcohol use among individuals with prior alcohol use disorder (AUD).
results_summary: The study found that 83% of participants no longer met AUD criteria after a psychedelic experience, with significant reductions in alcohol consumption. Greater psychedelic dose, insight, mystical-type effects, and personal meaning of experiences were associated with greater reductions in alcohol use.
population_specificity: Individuals with prior AUD (72% severe AUD), mostly White (89%), male (78%), and from the USA (60%).
effective_dosage: Moderate or high doses of LSD (38%) or psilocybin (36%).

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine the relationship between relative and absolute internal and external loads in collegiate basketball players using tensiomyography and accelerometry, with LSD pairwise comparisons for statistical analysis.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in absolute external loads (PlayerLoad™ and IMA™) and meaningful relative load changes between weeks, suggesting tensiomyography may better detect fatigue from relative external load changes than absolute loads.
population_specificity: Five Division I collegiate basketball players.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the hepatic manifestations of lysosomal storage diseases (LSDs) in adults and emphasize diagnostic and therapeutic approaches.
results_summary: The study found that LSDs, such as Gaucher disease and Niemann-Pick diseases, often present with mild hepatomegaly and splenomegaly but rarely progress to severe liver complications. Effective treatments like enzyme supplementation and substrate deprivation are available for some LSDs, such as Gaucher disease.
population_specificity: Adults with suspected or diagnosed lysosomal storage diseases, particularly those presenting with hepatic symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review existing studies on the effects of lutein on neurodegenerative diseases, focusing on its potential as a complementary treatment.
results_summary: The review found mixed results, with 4/17 studies showing improved cognitive function, 8/17 indicating reduced progression of Alzheimer's disease, and 2/17 noting improved lipid profiles, while some studies found no significant associations.
population_specificity: Studies included patients with Alzheimer's disease (14 studies), Parkinson's disease (2 studies), and Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (1 study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of alkaline electrolyzed water (AEW)-assisted ultrasonic extraction in preserving lutein's structure and bioactivity, particularly its ability to protect against blue light-induced retinal damage.
results_summary: AEW extraction increased lutein yield by 60% and preserved its all-trans form, enhancing antioxidant capacity. Lutein extracted using AEW significantly improved ARPE-19 cell viability and intracellular antioxidant enzyme activity, mitigating oxidative stress from blue light exposure.
population_specificity: ARPE-19 cells (a human retinal pigment epithelial cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of lutein as a hepatoprotective agent for treating intestinal failure-associated liver disease (IFALD), focusing on its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
results_summary: The study highlights lutein's hepatoprotective effects, supported by evidence from cell and animal studies exposed to liver-damaging factors like lipopolysaccharide, high-fat diet, and alcohol. It suggests lutein could be a promising therapeutic option for IFALD, particularly in patients with nutrient deficits due to parenteral nutrition.
population_specificity: Patients with intestinal dysfunction, particularly premature neonates and infants on long-term parenteral nutrition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of pH and heat treatment on the binding affinity between caseinates and lutein/zeaxanthin, and evaluate caseinates as protective carriers for xanthophyll-fortified beverages.
results_summary: Caseinates bound effectively to lutein and zeaxanthin, with zeaxanthin showing higher affinity. Lower pH and preheating strengthened binding, improving lutein/zeaxanthin stability and achieving over 70% bioaccessibility.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral lutein could improve fat graft retention by reducing oxidative stress, inflammation, and apoptosis in grafted fat.
results_summary: Lutein improved graft retention, reduced oxidative stress and lipid damage, decreased inflammation and apoptosis, and downregulated related gene expression.
population_specificity: Nude mice
study_duration: 1 week pre-treatment and 2 weeks post-treatment (total 3 weeks)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effect of lutein-loaded nanoparticles on Drosophila melanogaster offspring exposed to imidacloprid-induced neurodevelopmental damage.
results_summary: Lutein-loaded nanoparticles reversed behavioral and biochemical markers of neurodevelopmental disorders, including hyperactivity, social interaction deficits, and oxidative stress, while restoring Nrf2 and Shank3 immunoreactivity.
population_specificity: Drosophila melanogaster (fruit fly) offspring exposed to imidacloprid.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of Cordycepin (COR) on STAR expression in ovarian granulosa cells and its underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: COR downregulated STAR expression in both KGN cells and primary human granulosa-lutein cells by reducing SP1 transcription factor expression, mediated via AR-A1, AR-A2A, and AR-A3 receptors, and involving ERK1/2 signaling.
population_specificity: Human granulosa-like tumor cell line (KGN) and primary human granulosa-lutein cells from IVF patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of ultrasound-treated multilayer emulsions on the stability and retention of lutein under various conditions.
results_summary: The study found that ultrasound treatment significantly improved the emulsion's stability and increased lutein retention by 21.88% after high-temperature exposure and 19.35% after UV irradiation. The emulsion also demonstrated prolonged release behavior.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supplementation with lutein, zeaxanthin, and meso-zeaxanthin could reduce systemic inflammation and lipid oxidation markers linked to atherosclerosis.
results_summary: The study found that supplementation significantly increased serum carotenoid levels, reduced inflammatory cytokines (IL-1β and TNF-α), and lowered oxidized LDL, suggesting systemic anti-inflammatory and antioxidative effects.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.
effective_dosage: Lutein (10 mg) + meso-zeaxanthin (10 mg) + zeaxanthin (2 mg) daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of lutein-loaded PLGA nanoparticles on lens epithelial cell viability, reactive oxygen species reduction, and cataract prevention in rodents.
results_summary: Lutein-loaded nanoparticles (LNP) significantly reduced reactive oxygen species and cataract scores in rodents, with minimal impact on cell viability at concentrations < 0.2 μg/μl. Topical LNP treatment showed effective lutein delivery to the anterior eye segment without causing keratitis or uveitis.
population_specificity: Rodents (selenite-induced cataract model)
effective_dosage: Equivalent lutein concentration of 1,278 μg/mL (topical, once daily)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the outcomes of lutein supplementation in mothers and infants, its status and metabolism during pregnancy and lactation, and potential limitations in its application as a nutritional intervention.
results_summary: Lutein supplementation improved lutein status in infants, but its bioavailability is low, limiting its effectiveness. Encapsulation techniques may enhance delivery but require further evaluation in neonatal models.
population_specificity: Pregnant and lactating women, preterm and formula-fed infants, and term and breast-fed infants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether lutein improves HDL functionality, specifically cholesterol efflux capacity (CEC), LCAT activity, and PON1 activity, under various disease-associated chemical stressors.
results_summary: Lutein improved HDL cholesterol efflux capacity (CEC) and PON1 activity but reduced LCAT activity and median HDL particle diameter. It showed protective effects against oxidative and glycation-related HDL dysfunction.
population_specificity: Generally healthy human plasma-derived HDL samples.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of IL-1 cytokines (IL-1α and IL-1β) in the pathogenesis of PCOS and their effects on human granulosa-lutein (hGL) cells.
results_summary: The study found increased levels of IL-1α and IL-1β in follicular fluid from PCOS patients, which induced inflammatory responses in hGL cells and upregulated SERPINE1 expression via IL-1R1-mediated signaling pathways.
population_specificity: PCOS patients and primary human granulosa-lutein (hGL) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether lutein-loaded Pickering emulsions could improve the bioaccessibility of lutein and alleviate retinal thinning in mice with dry age-related macular degeneration (dAMD).
results_summary: The study found that lutein-loaded Pickering emulsions improved lutein retention and bioaccessibility (19.76%-53.34%) and effectively reduced retinal thinning in mice with dAMD by decreasing oxidative stress markers (MDA, ROS) and increasing SOD production.
population_specificity: Mice with sodium iodate (NaIO3)-induced dry age-related macular degeneration (dAMD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of low and high doses of lutein on memory and synaptic function in rats with vascular dementia induced by bilateral-carotid vessel occlusion.
results_summary: Both low and high doses of lutein improved spatial memory and long-term potentiation (LTP) impairment, but only the high dose restored fear memory, hippocampal cell loss, volume, and MDA levels. Low-dose lutein increased neurotransmitter release probability, while high-dose affected postsynaptic processes.
population_specificity: Bilateral-carotid vessel occlusion (2VO) rats as a model for vascular dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how EGF-like factors (AREG, BTC, EREG) influence PTX3 expression and production in human granulosa-lutein (hGL) cells and the underlying molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: The study found that AREG, BTC, and EREG upregulated PTX3 expression and production in hGL cells via the ERK1/2 signaling pathway, which was reversed by EGFR inhibition or knockdown, suggesting a role in modulating cumulus expansion during ovulation.
population_specificity: Human granulosa-lutein cells obtained from 20 consenting patients undergoing IVF treatment, as well as immortalized hGL cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether controlled thermal and trypsin treatments of soy protein isolate (SPI) could improve encapsulation efficiency and storage stability of lutein.
results_summary: The study found that SPI trypsin hydrolysates (SPIT) significantly improved lutein encapsulation efficiency (12.00-18.59% increase) and photostability (38.21% increase for SPIT2), attributed to enhanced hydrophobic group exposure, antioxidant activity, and particle stability.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to critically assess lutein biosynthesis, therapeutic applicability, and market potential, focusing on its effects on age-related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, inflammation, and other ailments.
results_summary: Lutein significantly lowers incidences of age-related macular degeneration, has anti-inflammatory effects, and improves visual contrast. It is an essential nutrient with antioxidant properties but faces challenges in production and extraction, making it expensive despite high demand.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human population inferred)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective properties of lutein against Alzheimer's disease (AD) and Parkinson's disease (PD) and discuss strategies to improve its bioavailability.
results_summary: The study found that lutein exhibits neuroprotective properties against AD and PD due to its high antioxidant potential and selective accumulation in the brain. Clinical and model system observations support its potential in managing neurodegenerative diseases, though bioavailability remains a concern.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of various model systems and clinical observations)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of jet-milling and pulsed electric field (PEF) on lutein extraction and preservation in spinach powder and juice.
results_summary: Superfine spinach powder (SP-superfine) had the highest lutein content, and PEF treatment preserved lutein levels better than thermal treatment during storage. SP-superfine with PEF also showed the highest antioxidant activities.
population_specificity: Spinach powder and juice (no human or animal subjects mentioned).
effective_dosage: Not specified (study focused on processing methods).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the optimal processing sequence (ultrasound followed by ethanol treatment) for improving the physicochemical properties of soy protein isolate (SPI) to enhance the stability and bioaccessibility of lutein in SPI-lutein nanoparticles.
results_summary: The study found that the sequence of ultrasound followed by ethanol treatment produced smaller, more stable nanoparticles with improved lutein loading. The bioaccessibility of lutein increased significantly (from 25.48% to 65.85%) and its release rate was modulated during gastrointestinal digestion.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers were presenting a case study of a young unmarried female with a hydatidiform mole (HM) and theca lutein cysts, not investigating Lutein's effects.
results_summary: The abstract describes the characteristics, symptoms, and management of theca lutein cysts associated with molar pregnancy but does not report any findings related to Lutein.
population_specificity: Young unmarried female with HM and theca lutein cysts.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supplementation with lutein and zeaxanthin could improve visual and cognitive function in preadolescent children.
results_summary: The study found that lutein and zeaxanthin supplementation significantly increased macular pigment optical density, serum levels of lutein and zeaxanthin, and brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF), while also improving cognitive performance, reducing eye strain and fatigue, and enhancing visual processing speed. No safety concerns were observed.
population_specificity: Preadolescent children aged 5-12 years.
effective_dosage: 10 mg lutein and 2 mg zeaxanthin daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of sunlight intensity on intracellular lutein production and phosphorus removal by an autoflocculating microalgae consortium in secondary effluents.
results_summary: The microalgae produced significantly more lutein (2.91 mg g-1) under low light conditions, demonstrating antioxidant activity, while maintaining high phosphorus removal (above 85%) and autoflocculation rates (98%).
population_specificity: Autoflocculating microalgae consortium BR-UANL-01 grown in secondary effluents from a wastewater treatment plant.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of BMP-9 in regulating StAR expression and its molecular mechanisms in human granulosa-lutein (hGL) cells.
results_summary: BMP-9 downregulated StAR expression in hGL cells and upregulated EMT-related transcription factors Snail and Slug via SMAD1/5/8 signaling, with only Snail being necessary for StAR downregulation.
population_specificity: Human granulosa-lutein (hGL) cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining lutein (LUT) with epigallocatechin-3-gallate (EGCG) could improve retinitis pigmentosa (RP) outcomes compared to LUT alone.
results_summary: The LUT-EGCG combination significantly increased lutein accumulation in the liver, improved retina structure, boosted short-chain fatty acid production, and modulated gut microbiota and antiapoptotic gene expression compared to LUT alone. It also downregulated IL-6 but showed no significant effects on other inflammatory markers.
population_specificity: N-methyl-N-nitrosourea (MNU)-induced mouse model of retinitis pigmentosa.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of a biomimetic drug delivery system (MMLNPs) for improving lutein's bioavailability and targeting capability in treating hypertensive heart disease and cardiac fibrosis.
results_summary: The study found that MMLNPs effectively targeted injured hearts, inhibited cardiac fibroblast proliferation, improved cardiac function and structure, and reduced fibrosis by suppressing the IL-11/ERK signaling pathway, with no observed biological toxicity.
population_specificity: Transverse aortic constriction (TAC) model mice and in vitro studies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects of lutein/zeaxanthin (L/Z) and quercetagetin (QCG) against LED-induced retinal damage in rats.
results_summary: L/Z and QCG, especially in a 1:1 combination at 20 mg/kg, reversed LED-induced retinal damage by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation while enhancing neuroplasticity markers and retinal thickness. The treatment suppressed harmful markers (NF-κB, ICAM, GFAP, MCP-1) and boosted protective factors (Nrf2, HO-1, GAP43, NCAM).
population_specificity: Wistar rats (n = 63, divided into 9 groups of 7).
effective_dosage: L/Z (10 or 20 mg/kg BW), QCG (10 or 20 mg/kg BW), or a combination.
study_duration: 28 days of supplementation followed by 48 hours of LED exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop stable, dual-responsive liposomes (Dr-lips) using lutein (L) for targeted drug delivery of chlorin e6 (Ce6) and paclitaxel (PTX) in cancer treatment.
results_summary: The Dr-lips exhibited excellent stability, high drug encapsulation rates (92.27% for PTX and 90.34% for Ce6), and demonstrated pH and photo dual-responsiveness for targeted drug release. They also showed remarkable ROS generation capacity and anti-tumor activity in vitro.
population_specificity: In vitro (laboratory study, no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy of 4-month lutein supplementation on carotenoid status and cognition in individuals with relapse-remitting MS (RRMS).
results_summary: Lutein supplementation significantly improved carotenoid status (MPOD, skin carotenoids, and serum lutein) but did not significantly affect cognitive function. However, increased macular carotenoids were selectively associated with improved attention and memory in the treatment group.
population_specificity: Adults with relapse-remitting MS (RRMS) (N = 21).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral lutein and zeaxanthin supplementation positively affects the FLIO signal in patients with early and intermediate AMD.
results_summary: The study found that supplementation significantly increased serum lutein and zeaxanthin concentrations, improved MPOD, and reduced FLIO lifetimes in the foveal center, with effects reversing after supplementation ended. A significant negative correlation between FLIO and MPOD was confirmed.
population_specificity: Patients with early and intermediate age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
study_duration: Three months of supplementation, followed by three months of observation post-therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether betacellulin (BTC) regulates connexin 43 (Cx43) phosphorylation and gap junction intercellular communication (GJIC) activity in human granulosa-lutein (hGL) cells.
results_summary: BTC induced rapid phosphorylation of Cx43 at serine368, leading to decreased GJIC activity in hGL cells, mediated primarily by EGFR and downstream PKC signaling. The study did not alter Cx43 expression levels.
population_specificity: Primary and immortalized human granulosa-lutein cells from women undergoing in vitro fertilization.
study_duration: Different time points (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of magnetic drug targeting using lutein-loaded nanoparticles for enhanced cytotoxicity against breast cancer cells.
results_summary: The optimized lutein-loaded nanoparticles exhibited controlled size, superparamagnetism, and significantly enhanced cytotoxicity (4-fold increase) against MCF-7 breast cancer cells compared to free lutein when exposed to a magnetic field. The nanoparticles were biocompatible and demonstrated sustained-release properties.
population_specificity: Breast cancer MCF-7 cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the antitumorigenic effects of lutein on non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cells and elucidate its underlying molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: Lutein significantly inhibited NSCLC cell proliferation, induced cell cycle arrest at the G0/G1 phase, and promoted apoptosis by activating the ATR/Chk1/p53 signaling pathway. In vivo, lutein reduced tumor growth and prolonged survival in mice.
population_specificity: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cells (A549) and mouse models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the antioxidant, antiviral, and anti-inflammatory effects of Tetraselmis sp. extract (TEE), which contains lutein.
results_summary: TEE demonstrated significant antioxidant, antiviral, and anti-inflammatory effects, including scavenging free radicals, reducing viral plaque formation, inhibiting nitric oxide production, and lowering proinflammatory cytokine release via MAPKs and NF-κB pathways. High-performance liquid chromatography confirmed a strong presence of lutein in TEE.
population_specificity: In vitro (Vero E6 cells, RAW264.7 cells) and in vivo (zebrafish model).
